message.content:
cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.CL, cs.NE 

The paper deals with the problem of catastrophic forgetting in deep neural networks, which is a common issue in the field of machine learning. The proposed method involves leveraging a large stream of unlabeled data, which is a technique commonly used in computer vision (cs.CV) and natural language processing (cs.CL). The paper also discusses the use of distillation loss, which is a technique commonly used in deep learning (cs.LG) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI). Additionally, the paper involves a learning strategy to avoid overfitting, which is a common issue in neural networks (cs.NE). Overall, the paper is likely to fall under multiple sub-categories, with cs.LG and cs.CV being the most likely.
